intro: Cynanchum kintungense, commonly known as the Kintung milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic, and it typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. Cynanchum kintungense is often found in mountainous regions of China, Korea, and Japan. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and medicinal studies.
